comments.content: Perhaps the most challenging project I have worked on, the new Festival du Nouveau Cinéma website had me juggling many considerations:
Making the micro-interactions as lively as possible while implementing an easily themeable design system.
This design system would allow for customization the “edition” of the festival being browsed.
The interface connects to multiple APIs and other integrations.
It is also 100% responsive and as legible as possible on most form factors.
A very dynamic page which showcases URBANIA’s mobile-first magazine: “Micromag”
What is inside the floating cellphone is the actual website: clicking the phone expands to a full-screen interactive experience.
Motions are triggered via scrolling position, and I tried to make transitions as smooth as possible to avoid jarring effects.'
It was quite the challenge!
This one I am very proud of! It’s a very straightforward website, and very heavy on content, but I strove to make the designer’s vision come true.
As legible as possible, with some attention given to animations, especially to provide visual feedback.
Much care was given to providing documentation and a sane codebase, so that the hand-off to the company that handles further development and maintenance went very smoothly.
With such a variety of content and page templates, this project demanded a rigorously maintained component system:
Pages with filterable, sortable lists, many carousels, a handcrafted Google Maps theme, shortcut cards, etc.
Its design is to-the-point and favors legibility and consistency; subtle animations provide a smooth browsing experience.
My role on this project was to work on animations and motion design.
In particular: the homepage interactive “hero” banner, the transitions when navigating to a topic, and animating the little green mascot.
Due to time and budget constraints, the scope of the work was later revised, which explains some quirks.
As of September 2023, some elements I implemented remain visible, however a lot of what I worked on has since been updated.
I had fun implementing the designer’s ideas on this one!
Because it was my first project with this team, I was still adapting to the toolset, yet I managed to ship it in time and with minimal technical debt.
This website was recently redesigned; the current one was not implemented by me.
